concept.title: eBusiness Overview
concept.abstract: The eBusiness process in the system provides and end-to-end life cycle of Order to Cash. This process utilizes Receipts generated from Sales Orders, or cash entries which do not post to Accounts Receivable, and Invoices, which post to Accounts Receivable.

conbody.p: It is important to understand the difference between Receipts and Invoices in the system, when, why, and how they are used, and their accounting impact.

ul.li: Receipts - Receipts create cash entry transactions and transaction lines when payment is received and do not post to Accounts Receivable.
Invoices - Invoices post to Accounts Receivable and have an accounting impact without receipt of payment.
Selecting Receipt as the posting entity allows for Installment and Termed Recurring payments.
Selecting Invoice as the posting entity allows for Termed Recurring and Evergreen payments.
